content: The following lists events that happened during **1968 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 17 January – Britain announces its intention to withdraw its armed forces from Singapore by 1971. - 30 January – The [Ellenborough Market](/wiki/Ellenborough_Market) is destroyed in a fire, causing S$253,000 in damages and affecting about 1000 hawkers and stall-holders. The market is demolished a few years later. ### April - 13 April – The PAP wins the [1968 General Election](/wiki/1968_Singapore_general_election). ### May - 1 May – The [Hindu Endowments Board](/wiki/Hindu_Endowments_Board) is formed. - 23 May – [Singapore Pools](/wiki/Singapore_Pools) is formed as a [state-owned](/wiki/Government-owned_corporation) [lottery](/wiki/Lottery) firm to combat triads and illegal syndicates. ### June - 1 June – [Jurong Town Corporation](/wiki/JTC_Corporation) is formed to develop Singapore's industries, taking over this role from the [Economic Development Board](/wiki/Economic_Development_Board). - 7 June – [Institute of Southeast Asian Studies](/wiki/Institute_of_Southeast_Asian_Studies) (ISEAS) is established as a [think-tank](/wiki/Think-tank) to research on trends and politics in [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia) and beyond. ### July - 1 July – The [Islamic Religious Council of Singapore](/wiki/Majlis_Ugama_Islam_Singapura) (known as MUIS) is established. ### September - 1 September - - The Development Bank of Singapore (now [DBS](/wiki/DBS_Bank)) commences operations. - [Keppel Shipyard](/wiki/Keppel_Corporation) is established to take over [PSA's](/wiki/PSA_International) ship-repair and shipbuilding services. - The [Singapore Air Defence Command](/wiki/Singapore_Air_Defence_Command) is formed. - 17 September – The first [A&W](/wiki/A%26W_Restaurants) store opens at MSA Building, making it Singapore's first [fast food](/wiki/Fast_food) restaurant. This went on until 2003, when A&W decided to leave Singapore. It made a return in 2019 to [Jewel Changi Airport](/wiki/Jewel_Changi_Airport). ### October - 1 October – The Keep Singapore Clean campaign is launched. - 17 October – The two [marines](/wiki/Indonesian_Marine_Corps) were hanged for their roles in the [MacDonald House bombing](/wiki/MacDonald_House_bombing). ### November - 5 November – Intraco Ltd is formed to promote Singapore goods overseas. ### December - 17 December – Sembawang Shipyard was handed back to Singapore. - 30 December – [Neptune Orient Lines](/wiki/Neptune_Orient_Lines) is formed as Singapore's national shipping line. ## Births - 10 January – [Zoe Tay](/wiki/Zoe_Tay), actress. - 8 June – [Teo Ser Luck](/wiki/Teo_Ser_Luck), former politician. - 16 June – [Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim](/wiki/Muhammad_Faishal_Ibrahim), politician. - 8 July – [Josephine Teo](/wiki/Josephine_Teo), [Minister for Communications and Information](/wiki/Ministry_of_Communications_and_Information). - 14 July – [Michael Palmer](/wiki/Michael_Palmer_(politician)), 6th [Speaker of the Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore). - 8 August – [Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng), Former [Minister in Prime Minister's Office](/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Singapore)). - 10 August – [Kumar](/wiki/Kumar_(Singaporean_entertainer)), comedian. - 16 October – [Mark Lee](/wiki/Mark_Lee_(Singaporean_actor)), comedian. - 27 December – [Lim Wee Kiak](/wiki/Lim_Wee_Kiak), politician and ophthalmologist. ### Dates unknown - Lau Siew Mei, writer. - [Benjamin Pwee](/wiki/Benjamin_Pwee), politician, business development strategist and consultant. ## Deaths - 19 July – [Emily Sadka](/wiki/Emily_Sadka), historian (b. 1920). - 9 August – Lee Poh Neo, daughter of famous [Straits Chinese](/wiki/Peranakan_Chinese) businessman and philanthropist [Lee Choon Guan](/wiki/Lee_Choon_Guan) (b. 1901). - 7 October – Goh Tong Liang, former legislative assemblyman for [Bukit Panjang Constituency](/wiki/Bukit_Panjang_Constituency) (b. 1894). - 27 October – Sir [George Oehlers](/wiki/George_Oehlers), 1st [Speaker of the Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore) (b. 1908). - 2 November – Richard Lim Chuan Hoe, barrister and former Deputy Speaker of the [Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore) (b. 1904). - 7 November – [A. J. Braga](/wiki/A._J._Braga), 1st [Minister for Health](/wiki/Minister_for_Health_(Singapore)) and legislative assemblyman for [Katong Constituency](/wiki/Katong_Constituency) (b. 1900). - 6 December – Lim Keng Lian, Hokkien tea merchant and community leader (b. 1893). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1968 in Singapore
